intro: Dactylorchis hoeppneri, commonly known as the Hoepner's orchid, is a rare and endangered species native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, moist environments within cloud forests. The plant features a slender, upright stem with a single or few flowers that are usually pale green to yellowish in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern at the base of the plant. Dactylorchis hoeppneri is characterized by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and conservation status.
